metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9208 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.4.0 to 2.4.12 and 2.6.0 to 2.6.6, the TCAP dissector couldcrash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/asn1/tcap/tcap.cnf by avoidingNULL pointer dereferences.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9208` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.8-1
libwireshark14 - 2.6.8-1
libwiretap11 - 2.6.8-1
libwsutil12 - 2.6.8-1
tshark - 2.6.8-1
wireshark - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-common - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.8-1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.8-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.8-1').
